They were active on the internet and in the field, delivering flyers and provoking riots on campus, and even murdering people. They shown to be presents in [[Empire State University]]{{r|Chamber Vol 1 1}}, [[New York City]] and [[University of Chicago]],{{r|X-Men Unlimited Vol 1 36}} [[Illinois (State)|Illinois]]. In ESU, the webmaster explained to [[Jonothon Starsmore (Earth-616)|Chamber]] their strategy: Humiliating mutants to make them feel outcast and leave, instead of killing them, which would make the victims martyrs.{{r|Chamber Vol 1 2}} ===Mekanix=== In Chicago, [[Thomas More (Earth-616)|Tom More]] hacked, under the direction of [[Alice Tremaine (Earth-616)|Alice Tremaine]], into the system of the class project of [[Advanced Physics Tutorial (Earth-616)|Advanced Physics Tutorial]], a device create by the Nobel laureate [[Simon Benes (Earth-616)|Simon Benes]] and [[Katherine Pryde (Earth-616)|Kitty Pryde]], among others. The failure of the system caused massive destruction in the city.{{r|Mekanix #1|#2}} Tom More participated in the rescue, and was saved by the mutant genoshan [[Shola Inkose (Earth-616)|Shola Inkose]], witnessing him using his mutation. After this, and learning his role into the massive accident, Tom distanced himself from the organization's leader and his lover, Alice Tremaine. Purity assaulted Shola's flat, deserted by him but visited by Kitty and [[Xi'an Coy Manh (Earth-616)|Shan]], who were looking for the mutant too. Both Tom More and Shola appeared to save the two mutants and Shan's sister and brother from the assailants.{{r|Mekanix Vol 1 3}} During a students' confrontation on a decree to ban mutants or Purity from the University, [[Wild Sentinels]] attacked the students center, considering everybody as "potential mutants". While Tom More quit definitively his anti-mutant ideology and help Kitty, Shan and Shola, Alice Tremaine flee out and find a damaged sentinels, who recognized her as a true human and authorized her as a user. Alice goes back to her parents' house to repair the robot. When [[David Alleyne (Earth-616)|David Alleyne]] kept his mutation a secret, until the hate group Purity outed him to his parents and attempted to attack him. David was rescued by the librarian at his school, the former New Mutant Karma, and her former teammate [[Danielle Moonstar (Earth-616)|Dani Moonstar]].{{r|New Mutants Vol 2 4}} ===[[Decimation]]=== After the [[M-Day]], they were now no more afraid about enter [[Mutant Town]], where they were looking for mutants to expelled into [[Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters|The Xavier's Institute]], who was turned by the [[Office of National Emergency (Earth-616)|O.N.E.]] and the [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]] as a safe haven for the mutants.{{r|X-Men: The 198 Vol 1 1}} They assaulted [[Lorelei Travis (Earth-616)|Lorelei]] next to the [[Wildkat Nightclub]], cutting her mutants hair, before [[Mortimer Toynbee (Earth-616)|Toad]] came to her rescue and bring her to the [[Xavier Institute]].
